neil.name: Dr Neil Malan
neil.research: Investigating the drivers and impacts of subsurface marine heatwaves. Developed a comprehensive naming convention for different types of subsurface MHWs (mixed layer, deep, thermocline, full depth, submerged and benthic marine heatwaves) based on their vertical structures and driving mechanisms.

sandeep.name: Dr Sandeep Mohapatra
sandeep.research: Examining how the large changes in Antarctic sea-ice might have affected the wider climate, particularly over Australia.

zhaohui.name: Dr Zhaohui Wang
zhaohui.research: Using a high resolution atmosphere model on the Antarctic margin to understand the factors influencing the Katabatic winds.

zhi.name: Dr Zhi Li
zhi.research: Using novel physics-based diagnostics to understand how the Thermohaline Circulation has changed over recent decades. Reconstructed AMOC strength and variability since 1940 using a water-mass transformation framework.

lyra.name: Lyra Huang
lyra.research: Working on three projects: 1) Understanding the dietary dynamics of dugongs, 2) Understanding their current and future distributions based on species distribution models, 3) Examining how thermal preferences of predator and prey species affect population dynamics using idealized models.

anand.name: Anand Dinesh Singh
anand.research: Working on two projects: 1) Understanding the local lead-lag relationship between SST and precipitation anomalies over the ocean at multi-day timescales, 2) Understanding if and why ocean memory has or will change using satellite observations, reanalysis, ocean and climate models.

shujing.name: Shujing Zhang
shujing.research: Examining the drivers of subsurface heatwaves. Project 1 uses the spice/heave framework to understand the processes driving subsurface MHWs. Project 2 uses a 4D tracking scheme to characterize subsurface MHWs and cluster them into different categories.

michael.name: Michael Eabry
michael.research: Working on the drivers for sea ice change, particularly the 2016/17 abrupt decline. Investigated SAM/ZW3 interactions and their combined impacts on Antarctic sea ice.

tom.name: Tom Schmultz
tom.research: Investigating the unique mechanisms that give rise to marine heatwaves in the marginal ice zone of Antarctica. Found that intense, unseasonably early sea-ice melt can shoal the mixed layer and precondition rapid heat buildup at the surface.

rosa.name: Rosa Fenhalls
rosa.research: Examining multi-decadal information from the Hawkesbury estuary. Using machine learning to link local temperatures with large-scale environmental conditions to extend the timeseries.

siying.name: Siying Liu
siying.research: Using Lagrangian techniques in an eddy-resolving ocean hindcast to examine how connectivity has changed between mainland Australia and Tasmania, with a view to understanding the spread of sea urchins.

rishav.name: Dr Rishav Goyal
rishav.research: Demonstrated that Montreal Protocol prevented equivalent of ~25% of global surface warming by 2050. Showed ZW3 pattern is generated remotely by tropical deep convection. Formulated new index for ZW3 accounting for variability in structure, phase and amplitude.

joe.name: Dr Joe Scutt Phillips
joe.research: Developed a Pacific tuna simulator (Ikamoana) to understand how environmental conditions shape tuna distributions. Used Lagrangian modeling to examine connectivity between assessment regions and dFAD dynamics in the Western and Central Pacific Ocean.

nico.name: Dr Nicolas Jourdain
nico.research: Examined IOD-ENSO relationships and their delayed influences, showing that negative IOD events favor El Niño transitions and positive IOD events favor La Niña transitions one year later.

charuni.name: Dr Charuni Pathmewaran
charuni.current: Senior Knowledge Exchange Officer, NSW Dept of Climate Change
charuni.research: Provided statistical characterization and physical understanding of compound terrestrial and marine heat extremes. Found significant increase in terrestrial heatwave days when adjacent marine heatwaves co-occur along Australian coast.

annette-phd.name: Dr Annette Stellema
annette-phd.research: Demonstrated significant projected changes to Indian Ocean circulation under increased greenhouse gas emissions. Found 24% reduction in Indonesian Throughflow, 10% weakening of Leeuwin Current, and 23-11% weakening of Agulhas Current.

dipayan.name: Dr Dipayan Choudhury
dipayan.current: Senior Scientist (Climate and Atmospheric Science), NSW Government
dipayan.research: Investigated rainfall prediction over Australia at interannual to decadal timescales using CMIP5 decadal experiments. Showed for the first time that a Pacific-Atlantic transbasin SST index is significantly related to Australian rainfall with predictability rivaling ENSO.

nicola.name: Dr Nicola Maher
nicola.research: Investigated drivers of decade-long hiatus periods in surface climate using CMIP5 models. Found little chance of hiatus decade beyond 2030 even with large volcanic eruption in high-emission scenarios.

sebastian.name: Dr Sebastian McKenna
sebastian.research: Examined the causes and impacts of sea surface temperatures in the Pacific and Indian Ocean. Analyzed surface layer heat budget to diagnose processes leading to SST biases in CMIP6 models.

charlotte.name: Dr Charlotte Page
charlotte.research: Used stable isotopes, water quality and oceanographic analysis to localize terrestrially derived pollution inputs to threatened near-shore coral reefs at Norfolk Island.

marine.name: Dr Marine Roge
marine.current: Left academia to raise a family
marine.research: In collaboration with NSW government, tested the effectiveness of the first regional coupled model for eastern Australia.

guillaume.name: Dr Guillaume Serazin
guillaume.research: Helped develop the first Australian regional coupled model (NOW - NEMO-OASIS-WRF). Investigated the importance of resolving high-resolution air-sea interactions at the mesoscale for representing East Coast Lows.

les.name: Dr Les Muir
les.research: Based at CSIRO, worked on climate projections for the Tropical Pacific as part of the AUSAID funded PACSAP project. Investigated time of emergence of climate change signals in models.

deepashree.name: Dr Deepashree Dutta
deepashree.research: Examined the role of clouds and large-scale atmospheric circulation in Arctic amplification. Investigated Arctic polar stratospheric clouds using chemistry-climate model.

yue-phd.name: Dr Yue Li
yue-phd.current: Climate Scientist, NSW Department of Climate Change
yue-phd.research: Investigated high-frequency ocean-atmosphere interactions over the Maritime Continent. Found that suppression of sub-daily coupling significantly affects mean SST and rainfall patterns during Asian monsoon season.

xeurong.name: Dr Xeurong Qin
xeurong.research: Examined Pacific Equatorial Undercurrent variability using Lagrangian trajectories. Developed Lagrangian iron model showing additional NICU source enhances iron concentrations consistent with observations.

claire.name: Claire Roucet
claire.research: Examined the drivers of co-occurring marine heatwaves flanking the equator in the Atlantic Ocean.

ritwik.name: Ritwik Misra
ritwik.current: Senior Manager, Commercial Analytics at HelloFresh
ritwik.research: Examined how marine heatwaves are projected to change in waters around Australia using 0.25° regional downscaled model. Found waters close to Tasmania characterized by largest increase in MHWs.

annette-honours.name: Annette Stellema
annette-honours.research: Examined projections of the Leeuwin Current in climate models. Using 28 climate models, showed consistent projection of weakening Leeuwin Current and Undercurrent.

kate.name: Kate Simmonds
kate.current: Senior Manager, Climate Resilience at Investor Group on Climate Change
kate.research: Investigated asymmetrical mechanisms influencing Australian temperature extremes in spring and summer. Identified asymmetries in observed relationship between ENSO and temperature extremes.

su.name: Su Nish
su.research: Provided detailed assessment of seasonal differences of marine heatwaves and marine cold spells in the Indian Ocean Basin. Showed large-scale climate drivers modulate extremes asymmetrically.

sarah.name: Sarah Perry
sarah.research: Investigated projected changes in ENSO's teleconnections over global land areas in CMIP5 models. Showed models project robust increase in areal extent of ENSO's teleconnections in high-emission scenarios.

yue-masters.name: Yue Li
yue-masters.current: Climate Scientist, NSW Department of Climate Change (completed PhD)
yue-masters.research: Evaluated monsoon seasonality and tropospheric biennial oscillation transitions in observations and CMIP models. Found overall improvement in simulation of seasonality in CMIP5 over CMIP3.

michael-msc.name: Michael Eabry
michael-msc.current: PhD student at UNSW (continued with PhD)
michael-msc.research: Examined Rossby wave propagation in the Indian Ocean associated with ENSO. Used Lagrangian trajectories and reduced-gravity model to identify ENSO-induced wave propagation.
